title: Giving retail investors more confidence after they invest
summary: This case study illustrates how I led the redesign of the post-investment experience, translating user research into a clearer, more coherent journey that reduced support demand and rebuilt investor confidence.
outcomes: 30% reduction in support tickets for funding summaries (MoM)
3/3 participants intuitively identified where their investment was located in usability testing
Transparent journey improved user flow and delight

sections.title: Design challenge
body: Imagine this: you’ve just invested in a crowdfunding opportunity you believe in, completed checkout, payment confirmed, but when you go to check your portfolio, your investment is nowhere to be found. It feels like your shares, equity, investment have vanished.
Uncertain whether the transaction went through, many investors turned to customer support, expecting their new investment to appear in their portfolio.
The nuance is that campaigns remain open for further investment, and the asset only moves into the portfolio once the round closes and due diligence is complete.

Esoteric terminology such as ‘Open investments’, ambiguous empty states, and vague progress indicators compounded the issue, leaving investors feeling disoriented at the very moment reassurance was most needed.

media.alt: Investor feedback quotes and mobile chat showing user asking about missing investment in portfolio

sections.title: Action taken
body: User interviews, support ticket analysis, and session replays revealed a consistent issue: investors struggled to find their investment immediately after checkout. Rage clicks told their own story.

The native app had strong business backing, giving us the space to prioritise this opportunity. Our first solution adjusted the flow, taking users from checkout straight into an 'Open Investments' screen, which tested well and reassured them their purchase had gone through.

inlineMedia.text: I saw it straight after checkout, but when I navigated away it felt like I lost it again.

media.alt: Mobile app investment dashboard showing Open Investments and portfolio

sections.title: Key findings
body: Testing was positive. The new flow reassured investors that their purchase had gone through.
But once it went live, behaviour told a different story.

Investors saw the confirmation, yet when they tried to find their investment again, the experience felt brittle. A success toast briefly covered the back button. The jump to “Open investments” made sense to us, but not to them. They expected to see their money in their portfolio. Instead, they saw something unfamiliar, and sometimes missed it entirely.
We were close. The solution worked on paper. But it still lacked clarity.
identifiedItems: Success toasts obscured the back button, interrupting navigation.
The transition from checkout to "open investments" lacked continuity, causing users to lose context.
The term "open investments" did not align with users' expectations or mental models and was frequently overlooked.
The absence of a clear empty state left users without guidance on what to do next.

media.alt: User journey map showing checkout flow, portfolio screens, and identified friction points

sections.title: Further actions taken
body: We simplified the journey by showing the portfolio only once an investment has closed.
By rethinking the information architecture, simplifying language, and introducing scalable components, we aligned the experience with user expectations and thus reducing cognitive load.
This approach removed a major source of confusion, replaced it with clarity, and established a scalable framework that strengthens trust in the platform.
identifiedItems: Portfolio only displayed once an investment has closed, removing confusion and creating a more meaningful first experience.
Live and closing campaigns are displayed clearly, making progress easier to follow and increasing transparency.
Improved status feedback such as live, closing, % completion give users continuity from funding through to ownership.

media.alt: Investment detail screens with deeper actions and further information modals
Portfolio screens showing in-progress investments and discover businesses modal

sections.title: Benefits
body: As a result of this release, support tickets dropped, investors felt more confident after checkout. The new framework now powers multiple investment journeys across the product, and scheduled to be rolled out across our web product.

media.text: Before, I'd invest and then panic because nothing showed up. Now I can actually see what's happening.

media.alt: Portfolio screens showing empty state, in-progress investments, and closed campaigns
